    • Constructor Detail

      • ClassicModule

        public ClassicModule(SentimentLex lex,
             boolean personCheck,
             boolean findSources,
             boolean findTargets,
             de.tuebingen.uni.sfs.germanet.api.GermaNet germaNet)
        Constructs a new ClassicModule object and instantiates a GermaNet object. Sentiment sources are filtered based on whether they are a person or a group of persons.
        Parameters:
        lex - A SentimentLex object in which the rules for finding sentiment sources and targets of a sentiment word are saved as SentimentUnits.
        personCheck - A variable that, if set to "True", will filter out sentiment sources which are not a person or group of persons.
        findSources - Only if this is set to "True", will the system look for sentiment sources.
        findTargets - Only if this is set to "True", will the system look for sentiment targets.
        germaNet - A GermaNet object

      • ClassicModule

        public ClassicModule(SentimentLex lex,
             boolean personCheck,
             boolean findSources,
             boolean findTargets)

    • Method Detail

      • findFrames

        public java.util.Collection<Frame> findFrames(SentenceObj sentence)
        Looks at a single SentenceObj to find any sentiment expressions and adds the information to the Salsa XML structure. Multiple frames per sentiment expression are possible, multiple sources and targets are not. We filter out a sentiment target if its head is identical to the head of the already tagged sentiment source. If the variable PersonCheck is set to "True" in the configuration file, we filter out sentiment sources which are none of the following: 1) a NamedEntity which is a person or an organization 2) a proper noun referring to a person or group of persons (see isPerson(WordObj)) 3) a personal or relative pronoun which is not of neuter gender
        Parameters:
        sentence - The SentenceObj which is to be checked for sentiment expressions.
        Returns:
        A collection of Frame objects. Each represents a SubjectiveExpression. Each implementation of this interface is expected to implement only a single strategy for finding sentiment expressions. Their results are combined by SentimentChecker.
